articles.title: "Skip and Loafer Exhibition" Reveals New Visual of Mitsumi and Shima Covered in Paint, Exhibition Details Announced
articles.summary: The "Skip and Loafer Exhibition" unveils a special exhibition anime visual. Venue maps for the Tokyo location and dates for Nagoya and Osaka venues have been announced.
articles.content:
The "Skip and Loafer Exhibition" based on Takamatsu Misaki's manga is scheduled to run from January 2-18 at Tokyo's Sunshine City Exhibition Hall A. The newly released exhibition anime visual features Mitsumi and Shima in a two-shot covered in various colors of paint. This visual will be used for photo spots and merchandise throughout the exhibition.

The Tokyo venue is divided into 10 areas, including a "Fun-filled Opening" zone focusing on the anime's opening sequence, a "Exciting Story" area where visitors can follow the narrative alongside original manuscripts, character photo spots, and voice comic screenings of bonus manga chapters.

The Nagoya venue will run from January 31 to March 1 at Aichi's Telepia Hall, while the Osaka venue is scheduled for March 14 to April 5 at Namba Parks Museum. Detailed timing information will be announced as decisions are finalized.

articles.title: New Series "Makina-san, Let's Play" Starts on Manga UP! - A Youth Occult Fantasy Where a Protective Charm Summons a "Beautiful Girl Vengeful Spirit"
articles.summary: Fujiーki Hajime's new series based on Tabana Tanabata's original work begins on Manga UP!, featuring a youth occult fantasy about summoning spirits with special cards.
articles.content:
The new serialization "Makina-san, Let's Play" by Fujiki Hajime, based on an original work by Tabana Tanabata, launched on Manga UP! on November 30th. This youth occult fantasy tells the story of a high school student who discovers that his protective charm can summon a beautiful girl vengeful spirit named Makina.

The protagonist, an ordinary student dealing with everyday school life, accidentally activates an ancient card-based summoning system. Instead of the terrifying spirit he expected, he encounters Makina, a mysterious and charming ghost who offers to help him navigate supernatural challenges. The series blends elements of romance, comedy, and supernatural mystery as the pair work together to solve occult phenomena affecting their school and town.

Fujiki Hajime is known for their detailed artwork and ability to balance humor with darker themes. The series promises to explore the relationship between the living and the supernatural while maintaining a lighthearted tone appropriate for its young adult audience.

articles.title: Anime "SI-VIS: The Sound of Heroes" Features Han Megumi & Uchida Maaya as Twin Roles, Episode 9 Insert Song Video Released
articles.summary: Voice actresses Han Megumi and Uchida Maaya join the anime cast as twin characters. A new video featuring the Episode 9 insert song has been published.
articles.content:
The TV anime "SI-VIS: The Sound of Heroes" has announced that voice actresses Han Megumi and Uchida Maaya will appear in the series playing twin sisters. This fantasy action anime, which explores themes of music and heroism, continues to expand its voice cast with popular talent.

Han Megumi, known for roles in series like "Hunter x Hunter" as Gon Freecss, brings her energetic voice to the older twin sister. Uchida Maaya, famous for her work in "Rascal Does Not Dream of Bunny Girl Senpai," voices the younger sister. The twins are said to play a crucial role in the upcoming story arc involving ancient magical instruments.

A special video featuring the Episode 9 insert song has been released online, showcasing the emotional climax of the twins' introduction arc. The song, performed by the in-universe idol group featured in the series, combines orchestral elements with modern pop styling.

articles.title: "Kimi to Idol Precure♪" - Hibiki Kaito Transforms into New Precure "Cure Connect", Comment from Sakuma Daisuke
articles.summary: The TV anime introduces a new Precure character, Cure Connect, transformed from Hibiki Kaito. Snow Man's Sakuma Daisuke provides commentary on the development.
articles.content:
TV anime "Kimi to Idol Precure♪" (You and Idol Precure♪) has introduced a groundbreaking new Precure warrior - Cure Connect, the transformed form of male character Hibiki Kaito. This marks a significant evolution in the long-running Precure franchise, which traditionally featured only female magical warriors.

Hibiki Kaito, a popular supporting character known for his musical talents and supportive friendship with the main Precure team, undergoes his transformation to protect his friends during a critical battle. His Cure Connect form features a unique design blending traditional Precure aesthetics with more masculine elements, including connection-themed motifs symbolizing bonds between people.

Snow Man member Sakuma Daisuke, who voices Kaito, expressed his excitement: "When I first learned about Kaito's transformation, I was both surprised and honored. The Precure series has always been about the power of hope and connection, and I'm thrilled to contribute to expanding that message in a new direction."

Fans have responded positively to the announcement, with many praising the series for its progressive approach while maintaining the core Precure values of friendship, courage, and love.

articles.title: "Gnosia" Anime Reveals New Ending Theme -梅田Cipher's New Song Featured in Non-Credit Video, Everyone Shows Their "Gno-Face"
articles.summary: The TV anime "Gnosia" unveils its new ending sequence featuring everyone's "Gno-face" expressions and a new song by Umeda Cipher.
articles.content:
The TV anime "Gnosia," based on the popular sci-fi visual novel game, has released a non-credit version of its new ending sequence along with a new visual featuring the "Gnosia version" character designs. The ending features a new song by hip-hop artist Umeda Cipher, known for his work in Osaka's underground music scene.

The most notable aspect of the new ending is the comedic "Gno-face" (Gnosia face) expressions shown by all characters - a reference to the game's signature art style where characters make exaggerated suspicious faces during debate sequences. Even typically serious characters are shown with these humorous expressions, creating a lighthearted contrast to the anime's tense psychological thriller atmosphere.

Umeda Cipher's track combines electronic beats with traditional Japanese instruments, reflecting the anime's blend of futuristic sci-fi and human drama. The artist commented that he tried to capture the feeling of paranoia and uncertainty that permeates the Gnosia experience.

The anime, which follows a group of space travelers trying to identify impostors among their crew, has been praised for its faithful adaptation of the game's complex narrative structure and psychological elements.

articles.title: "Everyday Host" Sequel Production Decided - Comments Arrive from Shimono Hiro, Yashiro Taku and Cast
articles.summary: A sequel to the short anime "Everyday Host" by Goto Nimo has been announced, with comments from the main voice cast including Shimono Hiro and Yashiro Taku.
articles.content:
The production of a sequel to "Everyday Host," a short anime based on Goto Nimo's original work, has been officially announced. The comedy series follows the daily lives of host club workers, presenting their profession in a surprisingly wholesome and humorous light.

The first season garnered attention for its unique premise and charming character dynamics. Voice actor Shimono Hiro, who voices the earnest protagonist Ren, commented: "I'm incredibly happy that we get to continue telling these stories. The 'Everyday Host' world has so much more to explore, and I can't wait for fans to see what comes next."

Yashiro Taku, voicing the veteran host character Kaito, added: "Working on this series has been a joy. The characters feel real despite the comedic setting, and I think that's what resonates with viewers. The sequel will dig deeper into everyone's backgrounds while keeping the fun atmosphere intact."

The sequel will explore new storylines including the introduction of a rival host club and deeper dives into each character's motivations for working in the nightlife industry. Production details and broadcast timing will be announced at a later date.

articles.title: "Pretty Series Crossing Live" Delivers 28 Songs Full of Surprises, Including Pretty Rhythm Tracks
articles.summary: The combined live event "Pretty Series Crossing Live 2025" featuring "Himitsu no Aipri" and other Pretty Series shows was held at Pacifico Yokohama with 28 song performances.
articles.content:
"Pretty Series Crossing Live 2025," a massive combined live event featuring performers from "Himitsu no Aipri" (Secret Aipri) and other entries in the Pretty Series franchise, was held on November 29th at Pacifico Yokohama in Kanagawa. This report covers the afternoon performance, which delighted fans with 28 songs spanning the franchise's history.

The setlist included not only songs from the currently airing "Himitsu no Aipri" but also beloved tracks from "Pretty Rhythm," the series that started the Pretty Series phenomenon over a decade ago. Performers appeared in elaborate costumes matching their characters, and the stage featured impressive lighting and video effects recreating the signature "Prism Show" performances.

Highlights included surprise guest appearances from voice actresses who portrayed characters in earlier Pretty Series installments, emotional renditions of series theme songs that brought many audience members to tears, and high-energy dance numbers that had the entire venue participating.

The event also featured special announcements about upcoming Pretty Series projects, including new merchandise lines and hints about future animation content. The evening performance promised different song selections and additional surprises for attendees.

articles.title: "Charisma: A Superhuman Sharehouse Story" Gets TV Anime Adaptation - Special Preview Video Released
articles.summary: The two-dimensional character content "Charisma" receives a TV anime adaptation announcement with a special teaser video revealed.
articles.content:
"Charisma: A Superhuman Sharehouse Story," a popular two-dimensional character content project, has been officially greenlit for TV anime adaptation. A special preview video introducing the main characters and premise has been released online.

The story follows a group of individuals with supernatural abilities who decide to live together in a shared house. Despite their extraordinary powers, they deal with mundane problems like household chores, paying rent, and navigating interpersonal relationships. The series balances action sequences with slice-of-life comedy, creating a unique blend that has attracted a dedicated fanbase.

The preview video showcases the main character designs and hints at the series' visual style, which combines dynamic action animation with warm, everyday moments. Voice cast announcements and additional production details are expected to be revealed in the coming months.

The original "Charisma" project launched as a multimedia initiative, including social media shorts, audio dramas, and character goods. Fans have long requested a full anime adaptation, making this announcement particularly exciting for the existing community.

articles.title: "Aipri" Live Events Set for February in Tokyo and Osaka, "PriPara" Gaarmageddon Gets First Solo Event in March
articles.summary: Live event "Himitsu no Aipri Ring Ring LIVE" scheduled for February in Tokyo and Osaka. Team Gaarmageddon from PriPara gets their first solo live event in March.
articles.content:
Two major live events for the Pretty Series franchise have been announced. "Himitsu no Aipri Ring Ring LIVE," featuring performers from the currently airing anime series, will take place in February 2026 with shows in both Tokyo and Osaka.

The "Aipri" live events will showcase the voice actresses performing character songs from the anime, along with special segments recreating the series' signature idol performances. Fans can expect elaborate costumes, choreographed dances, and possible announcements about upcoming episodes and merchandise.

Additionally, Team Gaarmageddon, the villainous idol unit from "PriPara," will hold their first solo live event titled "Gaarmageddon Special Event: Devil's Feast ~Servants, We'll Curse You! Nano! Gaar!~" in March 2026. Despite being antagonists in the PriPara series, Gaarmageddon has cultivated a passionate fanbase thanks to their catchy songs and memorable personalities.

The Gaarmageddon event promises to lean into the characters' dramatic and theatrical nature, with stage production designed to recreate the "demonic" atmosphere of their performances in the anime. Ticket information for both events will be announced on the official Pretty Series website.

articles.title: "Therese's Sake" Volume 1 Released - A Human Suspense Drama Uncovering Truth Hidden in an Elderly Man's Love-Driven Crime Confession
articles.summary: Uchiyama Yuuji's single-volume manga "Therese's Sake" launches, exploring the real truth behind an elderly man's criminal confession driven by love.
articles.content:
Uchiyama Yuuji's single-volume manga "Therese's Sake" (Thérèse no Tame ni) was released on November 29th, presenting a profound human suspense story about love, aging, and truth.

The narrative centers on an elderly man who confesses to a crime allegedly committed out of love. However, as investigators dig deeper into his testimony, inconsistencies emerge that suggest a more complex truth. The story explores themes of memory, reliability of confession, and how society views elderly individuals, particularly regarding their emotional and romantic lives.

Uchiyama is known for creating psychologically complex narratives with deep character studies. "Therese's Sake" continues this tradition, offering readers a mystery that's less about solving a crime and more about understanding human motivation and the subjective nature of truth. The title references both a character and themes of sacrifice and devotion.

The manga has been praised for its mature handling of elderly romance and its realistic portrayal of investigative procedures. Rather than relying on dramatic twists, the story builds tension through gradually revealed details about the protagonist's past and his relationship with the mysterious Therese.

articles.title: "Peace Appliance Store" New Work "Omatsuri! Peace Appliance Store" Volume 1 on Sale, Previous Work's Digital Edition Also Debuts
articles.summary: Nouda Tatsuki's "Omatsuri! Peace Appliance Store" Volume 1 released, with the previous series also becoming available digitally.
articles.content:
"Omatsuri! Peace Appliance Store" (Festival! Peace Appliance Store) Volume 1 by Nouda Tatsuki was released on November 29th. This new series serves as a continuation of the beloved "Peace Appliance Store" manga, which followed the daily lives of employees at a small neighborhood electronics shop.

The new series maintains the heartwarming slice-of-life atmosphere of the original while introducing fresh storylines centered around local festivals and community events. The characters from the original series return, now facing new challenges as they work to preserve traditional festivals in their changing neighborhood.

In conjunction with the new volume's release, the complete original "Peace Appliance Store" series has been made available in digital format for the first time, allowing new readers to easily catch up on the story. Both physical and digital versions come with retailer-specific bonus items, including character illustrations and behind-the-scenes commentary from Nouda.

Nouda Tatsuki is known for creating warm, character-driven stories that celebrate everyday life and community bonds. Fans of the original series have praised "Omatsuri!" for successfully recapturing the gentle charm that made "Peace Appliance Store" a fan favorite.

articles.title: "Marriage Activity Match to the Future" Adapted as TikTok Short Drama, Natsuna's Role Played by Oda Nana
articles.summary: Wadate Saku's "Marriage Activity Match to the Future" becomes a live-action vertical short drama series on TikTok, with Oda Nana cast as protagonist Natsuna.
articles.content:
"Marriage Activity Match to the Future" by Wadate Saku has been adapted into a live-action vertical short drama, with episodes being released on TikTok's official Saikomi Short Drama account starting November 29th.

The series follows Natsuna, a woman struggling with marriage hunting (konkatsu) who discovers a mysterious app that allows her to glimpse potential futures with prospective partners. Oda Nana, known for her versatile acting roles, portrays the protagonist in this adaptation. The vertical format is specifically designed for mobile viewing, with each episode running approximately 1-2 minutes.

The original manga gained popularity for its blend of romantic comedy and light science fiction elements, asking questions about destiny, choice, and what truly makes a relationship work. The TikTok adaptation maintains the story's core themes while condensing the narrative into bite-sized episodes perfect for the platform's audience.

Saikomi, the manga publisher, has been actively expanding into short-form drama adaptations as a way to reach younger audiences and introduce manga properties to viewers who might not typically read comics. The vertical format and short episode length make it easy for viewers to watch during commutes or breaks.

Promotion codes included with the drama release provide access to free chapters of the original manga on Saikomi's app.

articles.title: Court Locksmith Kicked Out After Hiding [Time Stop] and [Molecular Decomposition] Powers - New Series Starts on Manga Box
articles.summary: Mizuriku Karaka's new series based on Nobuno Masayuki's work begins on Manga Box, featuring an adventure tale of an overpowered key magic user and an S-rank adventurer.
articles.content:
"The Court Locksmith, Kicked Out After Hiding His [Time Stop] and [Molecular Decomposition] Abilities ~The Sealed Demon King is Rampaging, But I'm Conquering Dungeons with an S-Rank Adventurer, So It's Too Late Now~" (shortened to "Court Locksmith") launched as a new series on Manga Box on November 29th. The manga is drawn by Mizuriku Karaka, based on a light novel by Nobuno Masayuki.

The story follows a former royal locksmith who was expelled from the court for being perceived as having only modest magical abilities. In reality, he had been concealing his incredibly powerful "key magic" - including the abilities to stop time and decompose matter at the molecular level - to avoid unwanted attention and political intrigue.

After his expulsion, he partners with an S-rank adventurer and discovers that dungeon exploration suits his abilities far better than courtly duties. Meanwhile, the demon king he had been secretly helping to keep sealed begins to break free, and the royal court realizes too late that they need him back.

This fantasy adventure combines action with comedy, as the protagonist enjoys his new freedom while his former employers deal with increasingly dire magical threats. The series appeals to fans of "overpowered protagonist" stories with a twist - the hero deliberately avoided power rather than seeking it.

articles.title: "Tokuni Aru Hibi" Reaches 100 Episodes - Shii-chan & Kimi-chan Acrylic Stands Giveaway Campaign on Comiple Official X
articles.summary: Naka Kento's "Tokuni Aru Hibi" celebrates its 100th episode milestone with a campaign on Comiple's official X account offering acrylic stands of the main characters.
articles.content:
Naka Kento's heartwarming slice-of-life manga "Tokuni Aru Hibi" (Nothing Special Days) has reached its 100th episode milestone, and a special campaign is being held on the Comiple official X (formerly Twitter) account to celebrate.

The campaign offers fans a chance to win acrylic stand figures of the series' main characters, Shii-chan and Kimi-chan. These two friends navigate everyday life together, finding joy and meaning in seemingly ordinary moments. The series has built a devoted following for its gentle humor and authentic portrayal of friendship.

To participate in the giveaway, fans need to follow the Comiple official X account and retweet the campaign announcement post. Winners will be randomly selected and contacted via direct message. The campaign also includes free reading access to select episodes for new readers who want to discover what makes "Tokuni Aru Hibi" special.

Naka Kento expressed gratitude to readers in a special illustration accompanying the 100-episode announcement: "Thank you for following Shii-chan and Kimi-chan's nothing special days for so long. Here's to many more ordinary yet precious moments together."

The series updates regularly on Comiple, a digital manga platform focusing on slice-of-life and comedy series.

articles.title: "Not a Magical Girl!" New Series Starts - An Otokonoko Becomes a Magical Girl While Searching for His Butt-Admired Idol
articles.summary: Matsumoto Drill Laboratory's new series begins in Comic Heaven January 2026 issue, featuring a story about a crossdressing boy who becomes a magical girl while pursuing his admired magical girl.
articles.content:
"Not a Magical Girl! (Mahou Shoujo ja Nai!)" by Matsumoto Drill Laboratory launched in Comic Heaven's January 2026 issue (published by Nihon Bungeisha) on November 29th. Character design is provided by Higashiura Yuuki.

The story follows a young man who, after glimpsing a magical girl's... distinctive posterior... becomes obsessed with finding and meeting this mysterious hero. In his quest, he ends up crossdressing and somehow gaining actual magical girl powers himself - despite being male and despite repeatedly insisting "I'm not a magical girl!"

The series combines magical girl genre conventions with comedy and gender-bending themes. Rather than treating the protagonist's crossdressing as purely comedic, the story explores his genuine admiration for magical girls as heroes and his unexpected journey into that world. The manga walks a line between parody and sincere celebration of the magical girl genre.

Matsumoto Drill Laboratory is known for their energetic art style and willingness to subvert genre expectations. "Not a Magical Girl!" promises action sequences, transformation scenes, and plenty of humor derived from the protagonist's insistence that he's definitely not a magical girl even while doing quintessentially magical girl activities.

The first chapter is available in the January 2026 issue of Comic Heaven, now on sale.

articles.title: "Himitsu no Aipri" Gets First Movie - "Movie Himitsu no Aipri: Mankai Buzzrium Live!" Opens March 2026, All Screenings Allow Cheering
articles.summary: The TV anime "Himitsu no Aipri" receives its first film adaptation, scheduled to open nationwide on March 13, 2026. All screenings will permit audience participation with cheering.
articles.content:
"Himitsu no Aipri" (Secret Aipri), the latest entry in the Pretty Series franchise, is getting its first theatrical film. "Movie Himitsu no Aipri: Mankai Buzzrium Live!" will open in theaters nationwide on March 13, 2026.

In a format that has become increasingly popular for idol anime films, all screenings will be "cheer-OK" (ouen jōei), meaning audience members are encouraged to cheer, call out, and use glow sticks during the film - recreating the atmosphere of an actual idol concert. This approach has been successful for other Pretty Series films and allows young fans to fully immerse themselves in the experience.

The film's title references "Buzzrium," a central concept in the Aipri series related to viral popularity and social media presence. Plot details remain under wraps, but the "Mankai" (full bloom) subtitle suggests a major performance or achievement by the main characters.

"Himitsu no Aipri" follows in the footsteps of previous Pretty Series shows like "PriPara" and "Kiratto Pri☆Chan," focusing on aspiring idols using augmented reality technology to perform. The series has been praised for its colorful animation, catchy songs, and positive messages about creativity and self-expression.

Advance ticket information and bonus item details will be announced on the official website in the coming weeks.

articles.title: "10DANCE" Netflix Movie Unveils New Scene Photos of Suzuki & Sugiki Dancing and Gazing at Each Other
articles.summary: New scene photographs from the Netflix movie adaptation of Inoue Satou's "10DANCE" have been released, featuring the main characters dancing together.
articles.content:
New scene photographs from the Netflix film adaptation of "10DANCE" by Inoue Satou have been released, showcasing intimate moments between protagonists Suzuki and Sugiki during their dance practice.

"10DANCE" tells the story of two professional dancers - Suzuki Shinya, a Latin dance champion, and Sugiki Shinya, a ballroom dance champion - who challenge themselves to master all 10 competitive dance styles while navigating their complicated relationship. The manga has been celebrated for its detailed dance choreography illustrations and nuanced portrayal of the protagonists' emotional connection.

The newly released photos capture the intensity and intimacy of partner dancing, showing the actors in elegant dance attire, mid-movement, with focused expressions. One particularly striking image shows them in a classic hold, eyes locked in concentration - or perhaps something more.

The live-action adaptation has generated significant interest due to the source material's popularity and the challenge of translating the manga's beautiful dance sequences to film. Netflix's production promises high-quality choreography supervised by professional dancers, ensuring authentic representation of competitive ballroom and Latin dance styles.

The film will be available for streaming exclusively on Netflix. An exact release date has not yet been announced, but production has wrapped and the movie is currently in post-production.

articles.title: New "Godzilla" Anime Series Announced - Protagonist is "A Boy with Godzilla's Power"
articles.summary: TOHO animation announces a new Godzilla anime series featuring a young protagonist who possesses Godzilla's power. Concept art has been released.
articles.content:
TOHO animation has announced the production of a new "Godzilla" anime series, marking a fresh take on the iconic kaiju franchise. Concept art introducing the series' unique premise has been released to the public.

The new series centers on a young boy who, through mysterious circumstances, has become host to Godzilla's power. This represents a significant departure from traditional Godzilla narratives, which typically focus on the monster itself or human efforts to combat giant creatures. Instead, this series appears to blend superhero coming-of-age elements with classic kaiju action.

The released concept art shows a young male protagonist with glowing patterns on his skin suggesting Godzilla's iconic atomic energy. The visual design hints at a more anime-style interpretation of the Godzilla mythology, potentially appealing to younger audiences while maintaining the franchise's epic scale.

Director and studio information has not yet been revealed, though TOHO animation has been expanding its portfolio of anime adaptations of classic TOHO properties. Previous Godzilla anime projects have taken various approaches, from hard science fiction to environmental parables.

Production details, including voice cast, broadcast timing, and whether the series will be theatrical or streaming-exclusive, will be announced as they are finalized. Fans can expect more information in the coming months.

articles.title: "Aspiring Noblewoman Dungeon Streamer" Volume 1 Released - Poor Unknown Streamer Aims to Earn 100 Million Yen
articles.summary: Papipopan!'s manga adaptation "Aspiring Noblewoman Dungeon Streamer Until Becoming a Real Noblewoman" Volume 1 launches from Tokuma Shoten's Ryu Comics Unicorn, based on Onikage Spana's novel.
articles.content:
"Itsuka Ojousama ni Naritai-kei Dungeon Haishinsha ga Honmono no Ojousama ni Naru made" (Aspiring Noblewoman Dungeon Streamer Until Becoming a Real Noblewoman), illustrated by Papipopan! with original story by Onikage Spana, released its first volume on November 29th from Tokuma Shoten's Ryu Comics Unicorn label.

The story follows an impoverished young woman who dreams of becoming a refined noblewoman but lacks the financial means to achieve this lifestyle. She turns to dungeon streaming - broadcasting her adventures exploring dangerous dungeons for viewer donations and sponsorships. Her goal: earn 100 million yen to fund her transformation into a true lady.

The series blends fantasy adventure with modern streaming culture, creating a unique premise that explores themes of class mobility and self-improvement. The protagonist must balance maintaining an elegant on-screen persona while actually engaging in the dirty, dangerous work of dungeon exploration. Her earnest efforts and gap between aspiration and reality provide both humor and genuine character development.

Papipopan!'s art brings the fantastical dungeon environments to life while capturing the protagonist's determination and occasional desperation. The manga has attracted readers who enjoy "streamer" stories, fantasy settings, and underdog narratives about characters working hard to achieve their dreams.

The first volume covers the protagonist's early streaming career and her first major dungeon expedition that could make or break her channel's success.
